item.title: Java Enum: Finding random enum from a range of them(?)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That’s one specific example, but a task or requirement system would be different, unless you have a new instance of whatever you use for each specific requirement

item.title: Java Enum: Finding random enum from a range of them(?)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“itai, post:5, topic:425455”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=528119.msg3850910#msg3850910 date=1324001575]
Here’s something you may want to consider:

If you just randomly go through all the values and see if they can do them, there is a chance (while slim) that you will continuously get a task you cannot do, and waste processing time. The same could happen if you do what t4 suggested.

Something you can do is first populate an array with the tasks the person can do (iterate once), and then pick a random value from that array.
[/quote]
Going to do that, thanks.[/quote]

An easier way to handle tasks is to just have an array of available Npcs, pick one at random, and have another for the number of of Npcs to kill.

public class SlayerTask {
    private final int npcId;
    private final int amount;

    public SlayerTask(final int npcId, final int amount) {
        this.npcId = npcId;
        this.amount = amount;
    }

    // getters
}
public static final int[][] EASY_TASKS = new int[][] {
    {
        // npcId
    },
    {
        // amount
    }
};
private static final Random RNG = new Random();

public SlayerTask generateEasyTask() {
    // ...
}

Or something similar.

Read full topic

with shuffling the list, you can save it for further tasks - just pop it like a stack.

item.title: Java Enum: Finding random enum from a range of them(?)
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

Anyone have any clue how to have it grab a random task and check if the person can do it, if not retry?

public void giveEasyTask() { do { for(EasyTask e: EasyTask.values()) { //Find a random task while(!canDoTask()) //When !canDoTask() it will continue to grab random tasks until canDoTask() //Loop finding of random tasks } } }

Read full topic
